data.title: down home cooking and comradery
data.text: The food is excellent as much as the servers are friendly....  you share tables with other families which at first was odd for me coming from the east coast, but I love the interaction of everyone shortly after.... you can't order a wrong food item here... there's a wait at time, but that too is worth it all.

owner_response.author: Alex J, Manager at Eat At Joe's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Susan, I'm glad we could share some west coast hospitality with you! Thanks for letting me know both the service and food were up to snuff. Hope you can join us for another meal soon!

All the best,
Alex
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: 8am and packed with customers
data.text:
This place has been busy since 1969. Don't expect smart tables, cutlery and crockery. Expect high quality food at a good price.
There are long tables where you can get into conversation with your neighbors and suddenly you have new friends.

Fast and efficient service. Very interesting place to eat

owner_response.author: Alex J, Manager at Eat At Joe's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Happy to hear that you've enjoyed yourself so much at our place! We're certainly all about great food with great people, so it's awesome to hear that you've consistently seen that with us. We sure are looking forward to your next stop in.

All the best,
Alex
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Awesome place to eat!
data.text: Great place with good food and awesome service. My server had a cup of coffee before I sat down!! You do have to be friendly because of the seating but everyone is chill.

owner_response.author: Alex J, Manager at Eat At Joe's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
You're pretty great yourself, Jorge! Thanks so much for being such a fan of what we do here, and it's wonderful to see that you enjoyed the total experience so much -- that's definitely always the goal!

Cheers, 
Alex
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great place to meet friends for breakfast
data.text: This is a layed back place with a great variety of breakfasts for everyone. The servers are attentive to the diners, offering frequent refills on the coffee or tea. The food is delicious with choices from light to heavy like the John Wayne for the hungry. The place itself is fairly small and most seating are on elongated picnic-type tables and benches that allows customers to talk with other people at the table. I'm positive there have been many friendships made over coffee. This place could be taken very easily as a local neighborhood café if it weren't for the fact that many diners have driven there specifically from neighboring cities. That speaks for it's popularity. To quote from the movie Field of Dreams, ' if you build it they will come". Eat at Joe's is a testimony to this.

owner_response.author: Alex J, Manager at Eat At Joe's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Richard, we certainly hope people will keep coming to our place to enjoy some food and make some friends, so thanks for the inspiring quote! I also want to thank you for the kind words about the staff -- I'll pass them along. See you for more breakfast soon!

Best,
Alex
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best Breakfast!
data.text: Very popular place with the locals; service is awesome; people are friendly and food is served hot and it's yummy. Most favorites are the Breakfasts.

owner_response.author: Alex J, Manager at Eat At Joe's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
You're not alone in liking a lot of our breakfast choices -- quite a few people count those among their favorites! And while we always want  to serve you delicious food, I'm glad to hear the service stands out as well. Thank you!

See you soon,
Alex
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Awesome coffee
data.text: I had the hangover omelet that was good and I am glad they put the sauce in a bowl since it would have been too spicy other wise. It's is three days latter and I am still talking about the coffee. Service was great as well.

owner_response.author: Alex J, Manager at Eat At Joe's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Glad the coffee made such an impression, Steve! And we never want the omelets to be too spicy, so it's great to know the sauce on the side worked for you. I'll also pass along your words about the service to the rest of the team -- thanks!

See you soon,
Alex
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Local Breakfast Joint
data.text:
Just happened to stumble onto this place while staying in the area.

Excellent breakfast.  It appears to be local and longtime breakfast/lunch joint as it was very crowded but moved very fast as well.  Menu had lots of what appeared to be refined offerings that have a unique twist to make it their own.  Portions were very large and staff was very prompt and friendly.  Would love to have one of these down the street form my house

owner_response.author: Alex J, Manager at Eat At Joe's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
We'd love to be down the street from you too, Jeff -- maybe one day! Thanks for dropping by while you were in the area. Hope you can join us for another breakfast next time you're in town!

Best,
Alex
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Excellent low key dinner
data.text:
I always get the same thing, the John Wayne's special... Excellent!!! 

Super low key in the ambience and decor, on one side "private" tables, on the other long shared benches and table. Great spot if you like dinners. Always packed on Sunday's but usually the wait is short.

owner_response.author: Alex J, Manager at Eat At Joe's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
The John Wayne special is a great choice for a favorite, so I'm glad you like it! Hope you can join us for another one soon.

Best,
Alex
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Late nite dinner
data.text: Good crabs. Good service. Corn was over cooked. Did not try the boiled potatoes. One person in party had the Salmon. Would have preferred less seasoning.

owner_response.author: Alex J, Manager at Eat At Joe's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for the feedback! I'm glad to hear both the crabs and service were to your liking, and I'll check with the kitchen on the other items. Hope to see you all for another meal soon!

Best,
Alex
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Brekky
data.text:
Lovely breakfast, with huge portions for a reasonable price. Just a short wait and very friendly staff. 
Will come again!

owner_response.author: Alex J, Manager at Eat At Joe's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Glad our breakfast could hit the spot, Thomas! And of course, I love hearing that the staff took great care of you. We're looking forward to your next visit!

See you soon,
Alex
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great hidden breakfast place
data.text: We walked to Eat at Joes and from the outside it doesn't look like much. When we walked in it was so busy with what looked like locals. We luckily got a table and we got our coffee straightaway. There was a lot of food to choose from. We had a variety.. 2 people had pancakes and 2 of us had omelettes. I chose to make my own omelette and it was delicious!! Great little find.

owner_response.author: Alex J, Manager at Eat At Joe's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
I'm glad you found us, Jordan-Ann! Although we're often full of locals, we always have room for some new guests. And the pancakes and omelettes are both fantastic choices. I hope you can join us for more soon!

Best,
Alex
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Breakfast
data.text: Found Joe's on Trip Advisor and stopped for breakfast on Day 1 of our vacation.  There was a small wait, which was well worth it.  The portions were generous, the food was delicious and the prices were extremely reasonable.  If you're visiting Redondo Beach, this is a must stop.

owner_response.author: Alex J, Manager at Eat At Joe's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
It's great to know TripAdvisor is working for us -- thanks for stopping in. I hope next time you're in Redondo Beach, you'll join us for another meal!

Best,
Alex
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great food / fast service
data.text: Ordered an omelette - it was great.  Loved the diner atmosphere. Fast service. However- almost felt as though they were trying to be quick and rush us back out the door.

owner_response.author: Alex J, Manager at Eat At Joe's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Speed is part of the diner atmosphere, Kevin, but just because we're moving quickly doesn't mean we expect you to do the same. You're welcome to sit back and enjoy your omelette at your own pace, and I'm sorry if you were ever given a different impression. Hope you'll join us for another one soon!

Until then,
Alex
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Big breakfast for long day of travel home
data.text: We choose Eat at Joes for a large filling breakfast prior to a long day of travel home. We each had an omelet which was large and filled with the add-in ingredients.  Waitress was very friendly and left a coffee carafe as it was a busy time, we appreciate that gesture.  The bathroom key is at the cashier stand and is outside, but clean.  We sat at a shared long table with other customers but still felt private, ample space. Would return

owner_response.author: Alex J, Manager at Eat At Joe's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
You always need a good meal before a long day of travel, so I'm thrilled we could be that for you, Molli! I hope the omelet and coffee were exactly what you wanted. If you're in the area again, please don't be a stranger -- we'd love to have you!

See you soon,
Alex
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Quick lunch stop
data.text: Had been wanting to try this place for ages. It's been there since the 60's and always has customers so I thought I'd stop in for lunch. I had a delicious tuna melt with tasty cole slaw and plan to go back for breakfast.  Good food, good prices, good service in a casual atmosphere.

owner_response.author: Alex J, Manager at Eat At Joe's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you! Food, atmosphere, service, and prices -- you've covered all the important things. Speaking of food, the tuna melt is a fantastic choice, so I can wait to see what you pick next!

Looking forward to your next visit,
Alex
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Love the John Wayne Special!
data.text: Just came in town to visit and had to stop by Joe's for their John Wayne special. I've had it at least 20 times and never get tired of it. I get it with the corn tortillas and add a little of their spicy salsa. Delicious!

owner_response.author: Alex J, Manager at Eat At Joe's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dana, I don't know what the record for the number of John Wayne specials consumed is, but you may be a contender. Thanks for being so loyal to us and to John Wayne. See you for another one soon!

Best,
Alex
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Best prices!
data.text:
We weren't sure where to eat because all of the beach side restaurants were very pricey and not necessarily good looking. However, we were told to come here by a California resident.
Pros: Great prices and plate sizes. There are gluten free and vegetarian options! They have mastered gluten free breakfast items. My wife loved it. Also, the staff are very welcoming.
Cons: Excessive amounts of eyelash hair in my eggs?? kind of random and the place isn't the fanciest.

owner_response.author: Alex J, Manager at Eat At Joe's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Before I address all the lovely things you have to say about our place, I want to start out by saying I'm sorry. There's no reason your eggs should have been like that, and it doesn't sound at all usual. We follow all health and safety regulations, so something like this should never happen. I'm glad the rest of the meal was awesome -- we love being able to take care of our guests with gluten allergies. I hope because you enjoyed the rest of the meal, you'll give us another chance to provide a flawless experience.

Best,
Alex
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great food great value
data.text: Wandered up here from the hotel after finding onine. Had breakfast here twice. Once alone and once with a colleague. Service fabulous and the place was humming. First visit turkey scramble with spinach and rice. Delicious. Second visit biscuits, gravy, sausage eggs and hash browns. My colleague had a south western omelette. So cool that these neighbourhood places are so well supported and flourish. I will return.

owner_response.author: Alex J, Manager at Eat At Joe's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you, Harry! I'm thrilled we could give you such a great meal on your first visit that you came back for more. (And brought a friend!) All of things you ordered are fantastic, but I really love the biscuits and gravy, so great choice. Looking forward to your next visit!

Until then,
Alex
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great breakfast - no elbow room!
data.text:
Wonderful food! Great place! Great service! 

They seat all their guests at the same table - it's nice to meet someone and chat a bit but if you are looking for privacy you will want to go somewhere else. 

You wait outside and write your name on paper, which seems odd, but they seat you very quickly!

owner_response.author: Alex J, Manager at Eat At Joe's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for the great review -- I appreciate all the feedback! I'm so happy you've found some favorites here, and I hope to see you back for more. 

Best, 
Alex
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: a small dive with great breakfast
data.text: You will most likely have to share a table with strangers and it will probably be packed and have a line but it's worth it. The service is great and the food is delicious. The portions are enormous, my mother and father shared an omelet and both were full. I had the John Wayne special with bacon and could only eat about a third of it. I have only had breakfast here and am not even sure if they have other food although I think they must serve lunch because there were what appeared to be lunch specials on the boards on the wall along with the breakfast specials. The bathrooms are outside and you have to take a key off the wall in order to use it, make sure to put it back when you are done.

owner_response.author: Alex J, Manager at Eat At Joe's, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Glad just about everything is perfect for you -- thanks for a great review! I'm glad you love the community atmosphere around here, and I hope you make it back in again soon. 

Best, 
Alex
owner_response.title: Owner Response
